Of embraces and colours

23 Mar 2020 - Khan

Sounds fade out
Your vision turns grey
This will be your last bout,
But hey,
It’s time anyway.

The colour drains
The light fades
You stand there still
Wondering how you got there.

You struggle a bit,
You strain away, but
You know it’s futile.
So you try.
You try and stay sane.

You welcome it now.
The pain feels at home.
Your will begins to crumble, but
You’re calm.

At Peace

It’s game over and
You quit it your way.

A sudden jolt rocks you.
Slaps the colour back,
“what the fuck?”
You say.

You fall into a warm embrace.
A euphoria.

It’s cosy here.
It’s safe here.
You love the hug.

The pain fades away
And the warmth encompasses you.

You hug your friend back
Feeling the hope creep back in.
You begin to think,
Maybe, Just Maybe
This won’t be my last after all.
